about.ods_paragraph_1: opendata.swiss is the Swiss public administration’s central portal for open government data.
about.ods_paragraph_2: A centralised and reliable tool, the opendata.swiss website offers easy access to the public data of the Confederation, cantons and communes. Where in the public interest, it also keeps a record of third party data – parastate enterprises or private stakeholders carrying out tasks on behalf of the Confederation, cantons or communes – even if the data in question have already been recorded on other websites.
about.ods_paragraph_3: In particular, the opendata.swiss website strives:
about.ods_list_1: To provide an overview of the OGD currently published in Switzerland in order to facilitate an exchange between the data provider and data users;
about.ods_list_2: To create an environment promoting the use of public data;
about.ods_list_3: To support the creation of a key part of the infrastructure for Swiss data.
about.ods_paragraph_4: Note that the portal is limited to referencing data. The data are hosted by their owner. This avoids any redundancy. As a general rule, no personal data are published in the scope of open government data. The data are aggregated and anonymised and do not enable the persons concerned to be identified. This is indeed essential in the provision of these data.
about.ods_title_2: Do you wish to publish data on opendata.swiss?
about.ods_paragraph_5: Organisations interested in publishing OGD can find information in the following online manual:
about.ods_paragraph_6: The Open Government Data office based at the Federal Statistical Office (FSO) which manages the portal. It supports organisations in publishing their open data. It also continuously monitors the quality of the catalogue.
about.ods_paragraph_7: opendata.swiss website is managed and was developed as part of the «
about.ods_paragraph_7_a: Open government data strategy in Switzerland for the period 2019 to 2023
about.ods_paragraph_7_1: », approved on 30 November 2018 by the Federal Council. The strategy is binding for the federal administration.
about.ods_paragraph_8: opendata.swiss was developed by various partner organisations under the direction of the federal archives until 2018. In 2019, the Federal Statistical Office (FSO) took over responsibility for the unit on behalf of the Federal Department of Home Affairs (FDHA). The website is developed on an ongoing basis together with the partners. A list of all
about.ods_paragraph_9: The organisations listed below support the OGD office in managing and developing the website:
about.ods_paragraph_10: You will find additional information and documentation on the
about.ods_paragraph_10_a: website of the Federal Statistical Office (FSO)
about.ods_paragraph_11: If a question relates to a specific dataset, please contact the point of contact indicated in the dataset directly. If you have general questions about the portal or the topic of open public data, you are welcome to

ods_open.condition_1: You may use this dataset for non-commercial purposes.
ods_open.condition_2: You may use this dataset for commercial purposes.
ods_open.condition_3: You are recommended to provide the source (author, title and link to the dataset).

ods_by.condition_1: You may use this dataset for non-commercial purposes.
ods_by.condition_2: You may use this dataset for commercial purposes.
ods_by.condition_3: You must provide the source (author, title and link to the dataset).

ods_ask.condition_1: You may use this dataset for non-commercial purposes.
ods_ask.condition_2: You may use this dataset for commercial purposes, but you must seek prior permission from the data owner.
ods_ask.condition_3: You are recommended to provide the source (author, title and link to the dataset).

ods_by_ask.condition_1: You may use this dataset for non-commercial purposes.
ods_by_ask.condition_2: You may use this dataset for commercial purposes, but you must seek prior permission from the data owner.
ods_by_ask.condition_3: You must provide the source (author, title and link to the dataset).

ods_section_1.ods_paragraph_1: Are you trying to find datasets which are not included in our catalogue? You can contact us to request publication of these datasets.

ods_section_2.ods_paragraph_1: Have you developed an application reusing data referenced on opendata.swiss? Contact us so we can make sure you are published in our application catalogue.

ods_section_3.ods_title: Do you want to send us data?
ods_section_3.ods_paragraph_1: The aim of this portal is to reference all OGD of the Confederation, cantons and communes in Switzerland. Third parties – parastate enterprises, persons carrying out tasks for the Confederation, cantons or communes – are also invited to publish their data provided that they are of public interest and even if they are already referenced on other websites.
ods_section_3.ods_paragraph_2: Do you wish to provide open access to data from your organisation on opendata.swiss?

ods_list_2.ods_label: Take a look at initial information on how to publish OGD

block_1.title: About us
block_1.paragraph_1: The opendata.swiss portal is a joint project of the Confederation, cantons, communes and other organizations with a mandate from the state. It makes open government data available to the general public in a central catalogue. opendata.swiss is operated by the Federal Statistical Office.
